title: Write unit tests for models and store

task.title: Write unit tests for models and store
task.description:
## Context
Ensure the foundation components are solid with comprehensive unit tests. These tests validate models and store behavior before building on top of them.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** haiku
**Estimated Duration:** 1h
**Approach:** Follow existing test patterns in `tests/`. Use pytest fixtures, tmp_path for file operations.

## Implementation Steps
1. Create `tests/test_toolsmith/` directory
2. Create `tests/test_toolsmith/__init__.py`
3. Create `tests/test_toolsmith/test_models.py`
4. Create `tests/test_toolsmith/test_store.py`
5. Test Tool model validation (valid/invalid IDs, required fields)
6. Test Catalog model (empty, with tools, serialization roundtrip)
7. Test ToolsmithStore load/save (empty catalog, populated catalog)
8. Test ToolsmithStore search (matches, no matches, case insensitivity)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Test Tool model with valid data passes
- [ ] Test Tool model with invalid ID format raises ValidationError
- [ ] Test Catalog serialization roundtrip preserves data
- [ ] Test store load returns empty catalog when file missing
- [ ] Test store save creates file and directory
- [ ] Test store load after save returns same data
- [ ] Test search finds tools by name
- [ ] Test search finds tools by description
- [ ] Test search is case-insensitive
- [ ] Test search returns empty list when no matches
- [ ] All tests pass: `pytest tests/test_toolsmith/ -v`

## Files Likely Involved
- `tests/test_toolsmith/__init__.py` (new)
- `tests/test_toolsmith/test_models.py` (new)
- `tests/test_toolsmith/test_store.py` (new)

## Notes
- Use `tmp_path` fixture for store tests to avoid polluting real filesystem
- Create helper fixtures for sample Tool and Catalog objects
- Test edge cases: empty strings, missing optional fields, Unicode in names
